title: Inbox area/list empty, but says I have messages
creator: djmozilla123
content:
My emails were all working (accounts were setup fine). Then, recently, when I opened Thunderbird, the main area (where my messages are displayed) is empty. If I choose another folder, still empty. BUT, the folders all say that there are messages in them (see the attached screenshot)

I have tried the following... 1. Opening Thunderbird in Troublshooting mode: This works, and the messages appear. But I don't want to have to open troubleshooting mode every time. 2. I have ZERO extensions installed, so asking to disable them obviously wont do anything. 3. I have tried to repair the folders (I have tried to repair the default inbox folder, and then tried to repair them all ... nothing worked). 4. I have backed up my thunderbird files, and tried reinstalling Thunderbird. Still didn't work. 5. I tried these three steps ... https://www.mboxtooutlook.org/blog/thunderbird-inbox-missing-emails.html Didn't work either.

Any other suggestions?

title: Windows cannot access the specified device, path or file.  You may not have the appropriate permissions to access the item.
creator: MiTasol
content:
My computer suddenly started the above error message for multiple programs. The local computer shop was able to sort out what appeared to be the root cause and that recovered some things but I still needed to reinstall a number of programs.

The program I am terrified of reinstalling is Thunderbird. All my emails on five email accounts since 2011 are stored in TB and I naturally do not want to lose any of them.

The major problems are the computer is running Win7 Enterprise and I am 82 years old so I am prone to needing things spelt out in greater detail than many others.

Can anyone provide a way to reset the program permissions (preferable) or identify the best way to reinstall and still access all my historic emails?

Thank you
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/115.0;os:Windows 7

title: Can't stop one email sender from going into Junk mail
creator: duhnel
content: In the past week emails from one of my friends started going into junk mail. The person in in my contacts. I selected 'enable adaptive emailjunk mail..." and selected the correct address book. The mail still went to the junk folder. I changed the 'move new junk mail to: my inbox, still went into the junk folder. I had him send me 10 emails that I marked as 'not junk' still no success. My emails come from yahoo.com - went there and there was nothing in the spam or junk folder in my yahoo email account. This is happening to only one email address. There's nothing strange in the title of the email or the content. I've run out of ideas.

title: PROBLEM SMTP SERVER
creator: huetclaudy
content: Subject: Persistent SMTP block on specific Outlook account (IMAP functional) ​Problem Description: Systematic failure of outgoing emails via SMTP on Mozilla Thunderbird for the address josettethirion@outlook.be. Crucial Note: Incoming mail (IMAP) works perfectly with the same credentials, proving that the authentication and the password used are correct. ​Technical Data & Actions Taken: ​SMTP Configuration: Server smtp.office365.com, Port 587, STARTTLS (or port 465 SSL/TLS). ​Authentication: Using a 16-character App Password generated after enabling Two-Step Verification. ​Symptom: Systematic rejection of the SMTP connection (Command Error 12 or timeout). Other Outlook accounts configured on the same Thunderbird client and the same internet connection (Belgium) are working without any issues. ​Tests Performed: Complete purge of Thunderbird's password manager, alias verification, and full restart of network equipment. ​Conclusion: Since the reception service is operational and full access is functional via Webmail/Outlook App, the block is specific to the SMTP protocol for this particular account on the Microsoft server side. ​Request: Please lift any security restrictions or reset security flags for the SMTP service on this specific account. My mail for respons : huetclaudy@gmail.com
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 10; K) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/144.0.0.0 Mobile Safari/537.36;os:W11

title: UNABLE TO SEND AND RECEIVE EMAILS FROM FREE-ONLINE (PLUSNET SERVER)
creator: gfinley
content:
1. Was able to receive emails sent to my address xxxxxx@xxxxxxx.free-online.co.uk, but unable to SEND my replies. Was getting this notification: 'Send message error. Sending of message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: Unknown sender. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again, OK' (see attached). 2. Checked all settings, all correct as used to be before the problem started. 3. At some stage, I tried changing the password in Settings > Privacy & Security > Passwords > Saved passwords > Saved logins to see if that helped. It didn't. 4. This time I also failed to receive emails in my INBOX (except for the Mozilla new sign-in email) and got this other notification: ' Login to account "xxxxxx@xxxxxxx.free-online.co.uk" failed. Login to server mail.free-online.net with Username xxxxxxx failed. Enter new password/Cancel/Retry'. 5. I tried Cancel and Retry (several times) but was still getting the same notif. (see attached). 6. I removed the free-online Server from the Saved logins (Provider: smtp://relay.free-online.net, User: xxxxxxx) with the intention of restoring it with a new password - but found I couldn't restore the free-online server. So I decided the best thing to do was to restore the password as it was before and to ask for help here. I will have to check on the webmail until the problem is resolved.

NB1. Free-online is a sub section of Plusnet. NB2. Last year I received an email from Greenby saying something about maybe taking over from Plusnet and that I would be notified if and when I had to do anything. I have not received any such instructions so left things as they were. Many thanks for your help from a not-very-techy so stressed old lady.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.15; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;tb_version:140.5.0esr (aarch64);os:Mac Sequoia 15.7.3 (macbook air M2)

title: The connection with my email adresses suddenly stops one day from another, using Thunderbird.
creator: info4277
content:
Van de een op de andere dag lijkt de server de berichten niet meer op te halen in mijn Thunderbird app. Het gaat om de mail adressen info@egoat.nl en support@egoat.nl. Ik heb de IMAP en SMTP instellingen nu meerdere keren ingevoerd, maar het lukt niet. Is hier een update geweest aan jullie kant?

Instellingen voor inkomende e-mail (IMAP) • Server: imap.transip.email • Poort: 993 • SSL: ingeschakeld • Gebruikersnaam: je e-mailadres • Wachtwoord: het wachtwoord dat je voor dit e-mailadres hebt ingesteld

Instellingen voor uitgaande e-mail (SMTP) • Server: smtp.transip.email • Poort: 465 • SSL: ingeschakeld • Gebruikersnaam: je e-mailadres • Wachtwoord: het wachtwoord dat je voor dit e-mailadres hebt ingesteld
